issue.title: build: Build warnings from deprecated std::get_temporary_buffer in std::stable_sort calls
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [x] I have searched the existing issues

### Current behaviour

Clang 20 generates deprecation warnings when std::stable_sort internally calls std::get_temporary_buffer (deprecated in C++17, removed in C++26).

### Expected behaviour

Clean builds without deprecation warnings.

### Steps to reproduce

Compile with Clang 20 (observed during fuzz build):

```
cmake --preset=libfuzzer
cmake --build build_fuzz
```

### Relevant log output

```
warning: 'get_temporary_buffer<std::shared_ptr<wallet::COutput>>' is deprecated [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
        std::stable_sort(vCoins.begin(), vCoins.end(), [&](const std::shared_ptr<COutput>& a, const std::shared_ptr<COutput>& b) {
                        ^
/usr/include/c++/v1/__algorithm/stable_sort.h:123:31: note: 'get_temporary_buffer<std::shared_ptr<wallet::COutput>>' has been explicitly marked deprecated here
    auto __buf = _VSTD::get_temporary_buffer<value_type>(__len);
                              ^
```

### How did you obtain Bitcoin Core

Compiled from source

### What version of Bitcoin Core are you using?

master

### Operating system and version

Ubuntu/Debian

### Machine specifications

_No response_
